Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CyberTag01
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Embassy Suites/business hotel. We are HH gold members and were upgraded to an Executive Suite. It was a very nice room for our family of 4. The sofa sleeper is EXTREMELY uncomfortable and we do NOT recommend it! Luckily we brougth our doube aerobed for our 15 and 18 year old to sleep on. The regular king bed was very comfortable. We had a corner room and even though it was not near the elevator, we heard the elevator all night. May have been because it was a corner room? The regular hotel staff is not very friendly. We had to call each day for towels as there were never 4 bath towels left by housekeeping. One day they didn't leave us any fresh towels. They do an excellent job on the breakfast in the morning. The managers reception was nice as well. They offer popcorn, pretzels, celery/cauliflauer and zucchini sticks with ranch dressing as their light appetizer. They also have a very inexpensive happy hour menu from 5-8 pm. It is a nice hotel and besides for the above small issues, we would recommend it and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Off to a rocky start”
Reviews.Author: CbnCampy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our three kids (2,7,10) were traveling from Las Vegas to San Diego for Spring Break. We chose this hotel because the one we normally stay in during our trips to Legoland was booked. We were due to arrive late Tuesday night. We had booked a non-smoking, 1 king bed suite. Knowing we would arrive late, I called Tuesday morning to advise the hotel that we would be checking in close to midnight and that I would love to have a crib waiting for us in our room since we would have a 2 year old ready for bed by the time we arrived. The lady at reception said she would send one right up and noted our late arrival. As planned we arrived around 1am. I went to the front desk to check in and the gentleman took an unusually long time to check us into a room. When I asked him if there was a crib in the room he said no but that he would send one up. We carried all our sleepy kids up to the 12th floor and walked into a very smoky room, my kids instantly noticed and complained of the smell. I called the front desk and told them that we had reserved a non-smoking room. He told me that they had over-booked and that I had the only room left in the entire hotel. I proceeded to tell him that its not my problem that they overbooked and that I reserved and was paying for a non-smoking room, how can they just give my room away? He said that they had oxidized the room extra to try to get rid of the smell for me...whatever that means it didn't work. He had no further explanation other than to apologize and offered me to speak to the manger at 7am. Still waiting for the crib to arrive, the one that was promised to have already been in our room, we put the kids to bed. The room smelled like an old musty smoky casino, I couldn't sleep and ended up hanging out in the lobby's fresh air until about 330am. I went back to the room fell asleep for 2 hours, showered and went to the lobby again to hang out until breakfast was served at 6am. At 7am I spoke to the assistant manager that was very surprised by what had happened. He apologized and told us we would not be charged for the room that night. He told us he would move all of our belongings as soon as a new room was cleaned later that morning. I left all of our belongings in the front room and when we got back from Legoland everything (except for the crib, which I had to request for again) was in a new smoke free room. The rest of our stay was great, but that first night was awful. The kids tossed and turned all night and barely slept, my husband and I barely slept after a six hour drive to San Diego. As a family with a toddler and two older kids we regularly stay at suite type hotels, which are considerably more expensive but for the added convenience of having 2 rooms it is worth it, so to have this happen to us was really a shocker especially from an Embassy Suites. All in all it was a good trip and a pleasant stay..after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Justmarried9-15
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at this hotel. The hotel was beautifully landscaped inside with plants everywhere and a beautiful stream with large koi fish. The suites were all very clean and contained all the ameneties I needed. The staff was extremely friendly as well. And of course you can't go wrong with the amazing hot breakfast with a million choices and the nightly manager's reception! It is definitely worth every penny! There is a PF Changs right outside the front door if the hotel restaurant doesn't sound good - plus a really nice outdoor mall is right across the street with a million other options for food and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Loud,”
Reviews.Author: freqtrav002
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal if you LOVE, crying babies, screaming teenagers (and as I write this there are six 13-year olds standing outside my window screaming over the balcony at the top of their lungs, 12 floors down to the lobby), fitness centers crowded with 8 year olds on treadmills... it is a really nice property but the lay out seems to cater to families, small children - if you are in town for business or traveling with adults i would say avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “mixed values”
Reviews.Author: mistyskyblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights from Friday night to Sunday. Overall, it is a good hotel, but it has some significant cons in my view. It has a pretty good location, close to freeway and La Jolla Village square shopping center. It is in atrim style architecture. The room is spacious and clean including a small frig and microwave. The bathroom is clean. We were on the 12th floor and were nicely surprised we did not hear much noise from outside the room given the style it is. Breakfast time was pretty crowded, but it seems good. Now the cons: Internet is about $10/day in the room. There is no free wifi in the lobby which many hotels do have it free in the lobby. The parking is about the worst I have seen. It has a few parking spaces to one side of the hotel, and a 3 storey parking structure. The parking slot for each car is very narrow, and the drive through path is narrow too. When a car goes out and while a car comes in, one of them has to back out in order for the other to go through. And you'd have to make a u-turn to drive out as the structure does not have a drive out path from the top parking storey. It is difficult if a car parked there for you to make a u-turn. And there are big block columns as well as cars parked right there at the turns so you are always afraid to hit either the block or the car. When I complained about the parking, the front desk gave me a designated parking space by the side of the hotel which is not that big either. So we end up still using the structure. They need to redesign and build a new parking structure. Another minor point is if someone is afraid of height, do not take a room on high floors due to the atrim open style architecture. It takes some getting used to. And there were a lot of kids running around in the hotel perhaps due to the weekend when we stayed. The pool was crowded with kids. So overall, the hotel room itself is good but amenities are not up to par. Its parking brought down its scores for me. If you don't have to worry about parking, then it is not a bad choice. For me, this hotel stays on the bottom of my list for right now.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly typical Embassy Suites, and while it has gone through some renovations, it is showing its age. My wife and I had a suite on the 12th (top) floor, and we discovered a drip coming from the ceiling in the corner of the sitting area -- either a leak in the roof or the plumbing had obviously been there for a while, since the ceiling was heavily stained and bits of the ceiling had fallen off at some time in the past. We reported this to the front desk, and they were very apologetic and offered to move us to a different suite. We didn't feel like repacking all our stuff, though, and the drip wasn't really bothering us that much. Despite that minor glitch, it was a pleasant stay -- the staff were friendly, and the suite was comfortable. We will probably stay there again the next time we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night while in the area for business and overall really liked it. It's an atrium-style layout with 11 floors. I had a 1 bedroom suite (true suite, not divider walled) that was spacious and well appointed. The hotel was completed renovated 5 years ago and further fitted with flat screen TVs a year ago. In addition to the usual coffee maker there is also a small fridge and microwave. Internet is about $10 and self-parking is $20. Everyone was friendly--I had to go to the nearby Hyatt for dinner and the bellman was happy to drive me over in the van. The fitness room is a little small for the size of the hotel, just three treadmills, a couple of elliptical trainers, and that's about it. It wasn't too busy when I was in there at 8 am but it wouldn't take much to fill it up. The indoor pool looked nice but too small for laps. There is a hot tub outside. The free breakfast buffet has a good selection of hot and cold items. It ends at 9 am so I stopped by after my workout, loaded some things onto a tray and ate in my room later, which worked out well. It did seem to get a little crowded and there were several people waiting in line for the omelet station. The Embassy Suites is not as nice as the Hyatt 5 minutes down the road, and you can't beat the Hyatt's beautiful lap pool and nextdoor enormous health club which Hyatt guests can use (for $13 I think). But the ES is a little cheaper and would be better for families due to the suite layout and free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “There are better Hilton Brand options nearby”
Reviews.Author: Brent C
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is for solo business travel, and my review would probably be different (and slightly more favorable) for vacation travel with the kids. After staying at nearby the Hilton Garden Inn (Del Mar) and DoubleTree (Del Mar), the Embassy ranks at the bottom of my list of Hilton choices when I travel to this area. It is not a terrible hotel, by any means; it just isn't my favorite among the various Hilton brand options in the area. For a family get-away on a weekend it may be the best option in the area, with the large family room and spacious accommodations. During my stay, however, I had the impression that the hotel seems a bit "tired" and stale (as are many Embassy Suites around the country), and the general feel of the hotel left me wanting more. That being said, all my interactions with the staff were very pleasant and the check in was very speedy and friendly. The Good: The location is very convenient, right off the 805 freeway and across from a large shopping mall with lots of options for food and beverage. A quick 15 minute drive over the hill takes you to the beach at La Jolla and the quaint and upscale shops and restaurants there. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable with a typical Embassy Suites layout of sitting room with sofa/desk in the front room and a bedroom in the back. The views from the taller floors are nice (for this area, which is very commercial). The bathroom amenities are nice (they even included a razor, shaving cream, toothbrush, toothpaste, and a mending kit). The linens and towels are very nice quality, however the pillows are synthetic and very spongy - if you are used to down pillows, you may wake up with a neck-ache like I did every morning. Staff is very friendly and helpful The Not-so-Good: This hotel is one of the more expensive Hilton options nearby for the regular room rates. Add $20 a day for parking and it becomes significantly more expensive, without delivering additional meaningful value. The parking garage fills up quickly and is so narrow you have to back up if someone comes the other way while trying to exit, which is incredibly frustrating when you are just trying to get to the office in the morning. The Free Breakfast: Standing in line for breakfast. Really? Come on! I am fortunate to get free breakfast at *any* Hilton (as HHonors Gold or Diamond) so the "free" breakfast at the Embassy was not my reason for choosing the hotel. However, if it had been, the deal-killer for me is that there is no quick buffet for hot items like pancakes, french toast, waffles, etc. Instead you have to queue up behind everyone in a long serpentine line to order one person at a time. The problem is so bad, they even post a "warning" about it in the rooms!) You must stand in line for anything besides cold cereal, muffins, or toast. After standing in line 15 minutes my first day for two pancakes, I opted to go across the street to Corner Bakery for my breakfast the remaining days of my stay. As to the rest of the food options at the "breakfast buffet", they are less numerous and of lower quality than the aforementioned HGI and Doubltree, both of which offer very nice (and fast) breakfasts by comparison. For example, the coffee at the Embassy is made from coffee-flavored syrup and hot water that is mixed as you dispense it - like the stuff in a college dorm or cruise ship - it is not even brewed. (That was a big turn-off to me) I found the air in my room to be stale smelling; almost as though someone had smoked in the room some time before and the smell never quite cleared (there isn't a way to crack a window for fresh air). Also, I happened to check in on an unusually cold and rainy evening and I turned on the heater in the room (which inexplicably had been turned completely off). I quickly realized why it had been disabled by a previous occupant - the fan was noisy and the air that issued from the vents smelled awful - dusty and dirty and reminiscent of the exhaust from an old vacuum cleaner that needs to have its bag changed. In fairness, heaters probably aren't used much in San Diego, but it was still off-putting. Bottom line, if you are traveling on business and don't mind driving an extra 10 minutes, I would personally recommend the nearby Hilton Garden Inn or Doubletree hotels - you'll save money on the room rate and get free parking, plus you will have a newer room and a far superior breakfast in the morning, with equally friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: mdr9
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times while on business trips to our Home office in San Diego. The hotel is very nice and in a great location. You can walk to numerous great restaurants in the La Jolla area. It is still a drive down to Torry Pines or to the La Jolla area overlooking the ocean but not far. There is free breakfast and happy hour that is a nice perk. They do have an outdoor area with fire pits for a nice nightcap. This is a typical Embassy Suites set up that is done right and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Nurs09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites for a conference 2-17 thru 2-21-12, the customer service was excellent from check in through check out. The first room I was given upon checking in, I did not like because the bedroom window was right next to the highway, with a view of a part of the hotel's roof on the third floor. I went down and asked for it to be changed, and the young lady did so without a problem. The room was adequately stocked with fresh towels and pillows daily. I had to travel daily to the Hyatt Regency, the driver of the shuttle on the first day was Paul, before he dropped me off he gave me the number to call for pickup on my way back. Paul and Paige worked different shifts and was able to transport me daily for the conference. Both drivers were excellent!...courteous, friendly and very kind. Thanks guys. The daily breakfast made to order(free) was an added bonus. Though the hotel was booked, the lines for omelets, flowed smoothly, the breakfast bar was adequately stocked. Thanks to the Front Office Supervisor, Dibiana for her professionalism and prompt response in getting my paperwork completed. Overall, my stay at the Embassy Suites was a very good experience. I recommend this hotel for all categories of travel. The high level of customer service demonstrated by the employees, will have me staying at the Embassy Suites for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: jkinney4
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to find a room here on short notice, since we got downgraded at a different hotel. We were in town for a hockey tournament and lucky for us this was available, since the rink was right across the street in the mall. The kids enjoyed the breakfasts, snacks and pool. We enjoyed the space. We had a room with 2 double beds (bad) since we have to double up in each bed. Two queens would be nice, but I understand there is a space issue. Smaller beds equal larger floor space, I watch HGTV...I know. The only down side was parking, but it was really not that big of a deal, since we would come back late in the day. Plus, the best part, they let me check in early. Room was available!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a family of 20”
Reviews.Author: teachergirl01
Reviews.Content: We had a family of 10 adults and 10 kids for four nights. Great stay! We would have liked connecting rooms, but we've traveled enough together that we know that chance is hit and miss. We always try to make the effort to stay at the Embassy Suites because of the free breakfast and happy hour, and this was by far the best one we've stayed at. It is primarily a business hotel, which was nice for us because it meant our kids were competing with a million other kids for the pool in the evening! Thursday night was the best, as there was low business traffic. By Saturday night the place was PACKED, so we retired early as to not compete with the pool crowds. The breakfast lines can get quite long, but if you plan your morning and take the advice of the breakfast traffic card they put in your room, you will have no problems. (Wake up earlier... I'd rather lose 30 minutes of sleep then waste 30 minutes in the omelet line...). The breakfast is hot and plentiful, and basic buffet flavor as far as that goes. We gorged ourselves so as to hold off lunch longer throughout the day, and it is easy to do so with the large selection they have. The happy hour was great each night. Not as much of a food "spread" as we've have seen in other Embassy Suites, but again, as this is more of a business hotel, they aren't putting out the treats a family on vacation usually wants. All in all we all agreed it was worth it to stay in beautiful La Jolla for our San Diego trip. An added bonus is the mall across the street (we went there for dinner the first night. Fun! Watch the ice skaters as you dine! Try the Noodle Bar (not sure of the name) in the food court. So delicious!). And PF Changs shares the hotel parking lot. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Retreat”
Reviews.Author: GaryImperial
Reviews.Content: Needed to go to Scripts for an annual review and the Suites was the perfect retreat for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites is always a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Tommy88
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at Embassy Suites hotels. The suite was very comfortable and clean. We enjoy the cooked to order breakfasts and the afternoon "happy hour". The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Trip Adviser reviewers!”
Reviews.Author: PYT13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last night and chose it because of the reviews we had read on Trip Adviser. Using Trip Adviser to check out hotels in advance adds real value to a hotel stay. We had a great welcome from Kathleen on receptio, even though it was only noon and check is 4pm. We went to relax in the sun by the pool and Kathleen came to find us with our keys about an hour later. The hotel is very modern and comfortable. The suite was lovely. Free bottled water in the room. Manager's 5.30 til 7.30 reception with complimentary wine, beer, spirits. Fresh cooked hot breakfast (again complimentary) and even though they warn you that it will be busy with queues between 8 and 9, we turned up at 8.30 and waited about 5 minutes for omelettes. We strongly recommend this hotel for both business and leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: Riyah
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable and contemporary Embassy Suites. It is located right next to Westfield's UTC mall and steps away from PF Changs. We had 2 connecting 1 bedroom suites and then moved to a 2 bedroom suite. All the rooms were well appointed and spacious, with a microwave and coffee making facilities. There are laundry machines on each floor as well as vending machines for sodas etc and ice. Morning breakfast is v early and quite crowded so get up as early as possible if you are hungry. There is also a managers reception each evening with complimentary drinks and snacks. Kids will love the glass elevators and fish ponds. There is also a pool. I would def go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice in 2010”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: Both times for business. Embassy Suites are excellent hotels. Price is fairly steep, but i think well worth it. Excellent location in La Jolla, very close to beach and highways to get around. Will stay again next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - well located for SeaWorld and Legoland”
Reviews.Author: travelling_owl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights covering New Years with family. The hotel is modern and fresh with the usual Embassy suites room standards of a seperate living room and bedroom, this is ideal if you have young kids (as we did) as they can have a seperate room and not be disturbed. Hotel is well located and close to the interstate meaning that you can get to Seaworld in 15-20 minutes or Legoland in 30-40. There is a Westfield shopping centre over the road from the hotel, if you want to head into La Jolla it is a 5-10 minute drive and definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: JourProfSF
Reviews.Content: After staying in many different kinds of hotels with my family I have to give a vote for Embassy Suites in general and this one is particularly nice. For just a little more than we paid at a lousy Comfort Inn in San Diego the previous night, we had a lovely room with access to a pleasant pool (though it was indoor), a nice fitness center, terrific breakfast. There's a plushness and festive feeling to this hotel. My kids loved it. We were there on a holiday week and the hotel fed breakfast to a huge number of people with great efficiency (unlike the Embassy Suites we stayed in two nights earlier in Valencia where we waited in line 30 minutes to get an omelet). My only quibble is that they nickel and dime you to death (a Hilton tradition!) -- $20 for a cot, $20 for parking, $10 per day for Internet. We ended up passing on the cot and my kids shared the uncomfortable sofabed and we parked around the block for free. Just ask and they'll tell you where you can park. Despite this, I've become a big believer in Embassy Suites as a great chain for families.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: lalalandHK
Reviews.Content: We stay in Embassy Suites for 3 days during Christmas. This is the best Embassy Suites we stay in CA. The room is clean (perhaps due to the recent renovation), nicely decorated and very comfortable bed and bathroom. Most of all, the location is great, with a big shopping mall across the street and many little shopping village few miles away. The only thing I complain is the air condition which was noisy and turn on and off many times during the night.

Reviews.Title: “I love Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: JT03
Reviews.Content: I really think Embassy suites sets the standard for extended stay hotels. I like the 2 room suite concept; I like having a nice TV in both rooms; I like the made to order breakfasts; I like the managers nightly reception. Just a great way to relax and enjoy yourself. The one thing that I wasn't thrilled with here, and I don't think you can really get around this considering the location, was the paying for parking. Once you get past that, you'll have a wonderful stay. Great staff and wonderful conceirge!

Reviews.Title: “Friend's Birthday”
Reviews.Author: mikki74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate a friend's birthday. We kept getting phone calls from management saying that we were too loud and that the guests were complaining. In the meantime, guests with small children gave them free range, breaking dishes, running through the hallways yelling and no one had a problem with that. They also charge $20 per day for parking. Why do you think that is?

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: robertoed
Reviews.Content: This property is clean, well located, and the staff was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For everyone”
Reviews.Author: SenicGorge
Reviews.Content: From the lobby to the rooms, this is a great place to call home in San Diego. The food is excellent, the rooms are clean and the bed is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hollinshead1
Reviews.Content: Extremely polite and efficient Front Desk Staff. Something often not encountered in many "upscale" parts of Southern California. Bottom Line: The Suites are Remodeled. Fresh, tastefully appointed Bathroom. Nice Beds. Clean Linens. Oversized and Soft Bath Towels. High Quality Toiletries (Soap, Shampoo, Lotion) are all very nice. No need to 'Bring your Own Toiletries' which is a big bonus for Business Travel. The Suites are HUGE. Flat Panel Televisions. Great Water Pressure in Shower. Waterpik Shower Head is Above Average; not as good as a Speakman Shower Head. All of the flack about this place being noisy seems way overrated. Very reasonable sound levels. Nice Alarm Clock with built-in MP3 Player. Comforter/Duvet need not be inspected with a Black Light. Clearly they clean their duvet's. No Bottled Water in Room. Items in 'Pantry/Snack Shop' are reasonably priced. Nice Place. I'd book it again without hesitation...

Reviews.Title: “They just put me in a stinky smoker room”
Reviews.Author: gfun69
Reviews.Content: As a non-smoker it is an absolute annoyance to be put by the unhelpful und unfriendly receptionist in a stinking smokers room. Since you cannot open the window, there is no way to get a fresh gasp. I rate this as personal injury which should be prosecuted. Additionally parking and internet is very expensive. I will avoid Embassy in future.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to justify price paid! Far too many negatives...”
Reviews.Author: wasimmehr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2 bedded presidential suite, and although most would think this review is not applicable to them, my comments would relate to general things... On the positive side, the rooms are pretty clean and have most things you would expect, minus great views, even on the top floor. On the negative side, we felt that the accommodation was not worth what we paid... The USP of embassy suites is the cooked to order breakfast, and frankly it was a bit of a disappointment with limited selection... And I can't believe that a hotel that caters to tourists can have breakfast finish at 9am! We had to get out of bed just to have breakfast, after not having had enough sleep, which in a way ruined the rest of the day... We could see many others who were half asleep during breakfast, or come in their bathrobes! For an all service hotel, I would expect that a pack of batteries that they had would be delivered to the room, especially when we are paying for it... We were asked to come down and 'sign for it'... Not to happy! Parking is quite expensive at $20, and as explained in earlier reviews, is quite tight for space, especially for a 4wd... To summarize, I would definitely not recommend the 2 bed presidential suite @$500/ night, but if you need to stay in the area for a couple of days for business (thereby having to wake up early anyways), a standard room here at a much decent price could do...

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Nor18
Reviews.Content: The suite was spacious and it came with a free hot breakfast and free drinks for happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “A slight bump ahead of the run-of-the-mill Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: loveDCA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a couple of different Embassy Suites and this one is a slight notch above the rest. I had stayed in this location a couple of years back and it does seem like they had undergone some renovations since then. Renovations that improved my impression. The suites are spacious and well laid out (I was upgraded to a corner suite that included a rather large dining table). The public areas are much more thoughtful, compared to other Embassy Suites which tend to border on tacky. Breakfast is standard. The one negative that I had was that I requested an early morning "taxi" back to SAN and instead a town-car was called (even though I clarified taxi). Didn't have the chance to send the car back because of an early flight and was a little bothered that I was the victim of an obvious back-pocket payment...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for families”
Reviews.Author: STM65
Reviews.Content: Pros : This hotel is great for families. The suites are spacious, with 2 TVs. The sofa bed is comfortable. The free real Breakfast is a very good deal - especially for kids. The indoor pool, is great for young kids. Gym facilities are very adequate. Location across from the UTC mall is excellent for shopping. Cons: Tends to be noisy and crowded on weekends due to many families. Not the best hotel for business travellers. Parking is $20 a day ( can add up)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: StephanieOng
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with 2 tweens on the busy Labor Day weekend. We all like the hotel, and will consider staying here again the next time we visit SD. Pluses: + SPACIOUS CLEAN ROOM ~ We got a standard 2-room suite. Our room was well appointed with a microwave, an empty mini fridge, a wet bar, a full-sized sofa pullout in the sitting area, and a kig sized bed in the bedroom + GOOD LOCATION ~ Easy access to major freeways, 10 mins. drive to SD beaches, a mid to high-end malls just opposite the hotel, lots of restaurants nearby + PROFESSIONAL AND FRIENDLY STAFF ~ There were many families with kids (MANY!) at the hotel during our stay. The lobby was quite chaotic, esp. during breakfast and happy hour reception. However, the staff were well trained and were able to keep the place together. Minses: - PARKING CHALLENGES ~ The hotel garage is really TIGHT. We drove a RX350, and had difficult times getting in and out of the garage. If you had to use the garage, I suggest parking your car on the first level. On the upper floors, inflow and outflow traffic SHARE ONE SINGLE LANE. We had to park our car on the street on the 1st night b'cos the garage was full, due to a function at the hotel (Hotel did refund our parking fees after we spoke). And street parking was quite tricky on the Labor Day weekend. Patrons to PF Changs would park their car on the street too. We were lucky to always get the LAST spot for our car when we return at around 8pm. - ROOM NEAR ELEVATOR IS NOISY ~ We stayed in a room #830, across from the hotel elevators. My boys slept on the pullout in the sitting area. They complained about the noisy elevators and people getting in/out of it. My husband and I slept in the bedroom, and we did not hear the noises. Guess rooms near elevators are ok as long as no one is sleeping in the sitting area. - INDOOR POOL NOT HEATED, AND OUTDOOR JACUZZI IS TINY ~ well, just our preference - FEE FOR WIRELESS INTERNET ~ However you may use the business center computers to get free access to internet. There are only 2 computers. * The frontdesk has printouts of restaurants nearby, mall map as well as a local map of La Jolla. ** There is a small, nice and kid-friendly pizzeria called Regent Pizza on the NE corner of La Jolla Village Dr. and Regent Rd. It is a few doors next to Starbucks and Einstein Bagels. It makes both NY and Boston style pizza. We had their NY pizza and salads...YUM! *** Also tried sushi at BlueFin, which is in the mall parking lot, next to Wells Fargo. Good fusion sushi, extended menus and great services!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Good Breakfast, Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: midwestworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: The standards that are typical and expected of all Embassy Suite properties -- complimentary 'real' breakfast, good-sized rooms, and open lobby/central areas -- are all present in this LaJolla property. The breakfast area is large, and the food was very good. There's a nice lounge for relaxing in the evening that can handle a large group (we had about 20 in our party). The property is not close to the beach, but instead close to the business district. It is a bit off of the main highway. But this didn't feel like a disadvantage to those of us that wanted to visit the beach - it was an easy drive to the beach. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly, clean hotel in beautiful La Jolla”
Reviews.Author: myspacebobby
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Sunday of Labor Day weekend. No line at check in and was helped by a very friendly and imformative young lady who had is in our room in a matter of minutes. Beautiful property with an amazing atrium! Had read reviews that persisted to stay away from rooms near the elevagtor due to noise but at check in all that was available and i accepted and found that i heard no noise at all! Would recommend a lower level room because the elevators do become crazy packed at peak times so complimentary hot breakfast was pretty good but also try to hit that up as early as possible cause the wait in line could be 15 minutes if you dont! great overall experience here and wont hesitate to check back in next time im in town!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: temcandelario
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8/26 and 8/27... Pros: - The hotel layout, room layout and free breakfast - as with all Embassy Suites - Although parking was $20.00 (get over it - its La Jolla) the parking was very convenient - No issues with noise, comfortable beds and pillows Cons: - The cleaning was not thorough (although we are a bit extreme - we bring sheets, pillow covers and wipe everything down with alcohol.) We found hair in a "clean" towel (The cleaning issue runs across all hotels these days - maids assigned 18 -20 rooms or the "saving the environment" excuse to not change sheets, and wash covers on daily basis. - Carpet is worn and the room is slightly dated Front the desk folks: We were given a 3rd floor room and requested higher floor for better view - no issues and friendly staff - Thanks! Overall: Enjoyed our stay - no second thoughts! The area is so beautiful and hotel did not diminish our enjoyment. - So don't over think it - this is a solid choice. We will try the Hyatt down the street - next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Restful & very nice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kastombe
Reviews.Content: Loved their Happy Hour, great breakfast.. Lots of options. All and all a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and a good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Zahpok
Reviews.Content: The staff at the omelet station were always patient and friendly. They replenished the buffet often. The rooms were clean but a bit dark. One day housekeeping skipped our room entirely, but they made up for it and had someone come fairly quickly to clean the room. Their outdoor bar area is really lovely and we really made the most of it. My only disappointment is the pool area. Guests left their food and drinks on the table, which wasn't cleaned up for hours. The indoor pool itself was very VERY small. It was good enough for the little kids though.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, very helpful staff, near the University and shopping”
Reviews.Author: binduAustralia
Reviews.Content: Three visits in two weeks confirmed that this hotel is great value. Located near the University and shopping centres (not the seaside, more expensive part of LaJolla) the hotel offers large, clean, contemporary and well-equipped suites with a comfortable lounge room with all amenities, a spacious bath with a good (deep) bathtub and the bedroom at the rear of the suite which means it is quiet. The complimentary breakfast can be busy, but service is good, there is plenty of seating and the range and selection of breakfast items (including omelets and French toast) is enough to ensure you won't need anything else until lunch. There is a happy hour in the late afternoon with complimentary drinks and snacks. There's also an indoor pool which we didn't use, but was certainly popular during our summer visit. The lounge area on the ground floor is very comfortable and the water feature with large koi fish are relaxing and make for a very comfortable and relaxing environment, and a special treat for younger visitors. There are a number of dinner options within a five or ten minute walking distance and a major shopping centre with a food court during the day. If you need transport they have an excellent service which we used to go (twice) to the airport. Front office staff were particularly helpful. We arrived very early on our first visit (flights from Australia arrived at 7am and we were in San Diego before 11am) and although no rooms were ready at that early hour they stored our bags then delivered them to the room before our check-in in the mid-afternoon. My elderly father made our first booking and we were very impressed that the staff recognised him on subsequent visits and greeted him by name. This family-friendly, comfortable all-suite hotel will be our choice for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “"One of the Best Hotels during our 2 Week Stay in Cali"”
Reviews.Author: Comesanas
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in numerous Embassy Suites and other hotels, the La Jolla location ist the best by far! Our room was very accommdating, comforatable, decorated very nicely with up ti date furnishings. Our daily breakfast and happy hour was awesome. We started our day very full with a cook to order omelet, etc.., only to return to a welcomed happy hour with awesome appetizers. Downtown attractions such as San Diego Zoo were only 15-20 minutes away and La Jolla Beach was very close by. Ths hotel is the best stay for the vaule!!

Reviews.Title: “Always A Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: anncgrl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Embassy Suites in La Jolla several times and have found the accomodations and the atomosphere to be very enjoyable every time. One of the best parts of my stay is the delicious breakfast that is included in the cost of the room. My breakfast was made to order or there were numerous options such as fruit, cereals, bagels, etc. Since I was traveling on business this accomodation was perfect for getting ready to leave for meetings on time and made my food budget stretch. It is also convenient to La Jolla Beach and even to a hospital which, unfortunately, I had to use on one visit. I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Take the stairs”
Reviews.Author: Mctsnowboarder
Reviews.Content: This place by far has the worst elevators I've ever seen. There are four but out of our three night stay there were only three working. Our room was on the top floor so we had to wait to get picked up and then stop at every other floor on the way down. Due to the slow service our rides up and down were always jam packed. This hotel needs to get a better elevator service, like they do in Vegas. Designate two to go up the top floors and the other two to go the lower floors. It's not rocket science. Also the $20 a night for no parking or very little parking in the way parking garage is a joke!!! Good luck on finding a spot after 9:30pm. The rooms were nice but the flat screen tv sucked. They had the worst HD I've ever seen. If you can handle lines then breakfast will be enjoyable for you. I would think that in a big city the size of San Diego is you'd be able to find a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a flop”
Reviews.Author: trippin7
Reviews.Content: Forwarned is forearmed. So if you decide to brave the gauntlet (Emabassy Suites, La Jolla) just know this: 1) My wife mistakenly booked through their central reservation system (did not use agent or internet) and got a $325/night price on a cruddy room (will keep adjectives G rated) 2) When our friends mentioned their room rate ($175), I felt, well, less fortunate. But i thought pragmatism (Emabsyy Suite's) would rule the day as I set out for the front desk. So the conversation went, "Can you please look at my room rate?" "Mmm, very high room rate." (Not kidding, that's what the front desk said). "Can you make an adjustment? I can rebook right now through the internet and get $150 discount on the room I am in." "No, it is what it is." (I paraphrase their repsonse) 3) The rooms are barely woth $99/night. We received housekeeping exactly 1 time during our 3 night stay and that was after we harassed the front desk at 5:00 pm the day received our only "cleaning" 4) bathroom floor very hairy when we checked into our "luxury" suite." (Result of lazy housekeeping, I opine) 5) "free breakfast" chaos at 8 am. cold eggs, cold bacon, you get the idea 6) 3 Paul Blart mallcops patrolling the hotel all night/every night. Weird vibe. Why do they need 3 rental security guards haranguing kids for putting their toes in the hottub or being too loud at 8:00 pm? 7) Imagine this: The lyrics sung by the Inn Keeper in Les Mis...."Charging the guest for a little of this and a little of that" Parking extra, internet extra..... 8) front desk...a line, 4 deep all day every day 9) This may be piling on, but the "free happy hour," what a treat. watery cocktails and chips and canned salsa. Some of our group left a night early and checked into the Hyatt, better room, better rate. I should have done the same, but didn't, shame on me. Do your homework and investgate all the options; there are a plethora of options within a mile radius. And if Karma deals you the Emabassy Suites card. Throw back into the pile and "go fish" for something else, anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: Momtothree14117
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the 4th of July weekend and had a great time. The location was great for us and my husband really liked the fitness room. Due to the holiday, it was quite busy probably sold out but I didn't feel cramped. The housekeeping staff was great and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: PWithnell
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of their two bedroom (king and sleeper sofa bed) suites. Even with two children, my wife and I found that the room was spacious and offered all the conveniences we needed, including a separate dining area and a lockable door between the bedroom and great room. Indoor pool is small but functional and worked well for us. Location placed us in the middle of our destinations which included Legoland and San Diego Zoo. Had no issues parking as the hotel has a separate parking garage next door. We would definitely use this hotel again for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sedona888
Reviews.Content: Even though we only stayed one night in La Jolla, we were able to relax in our room at Embassy Suites. Had dinner at PF Changs across the parking lot. Nice atmosphere. Very comfy beds and pillows. There were a million kids there (soccer tournament) but since I am a mom, it didn't bother me that much to have them running around. We had to checkout before the breakfast, but it's always good there. Price of the room was extremely high, but there weren't a lot of options since ComicCon was in town when we were in the San Diego area. Always recommend Embassy Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Just three complaints”
Reviews.Author: golflover26
Reviews.Content: 1. $20.00 parking fee for an out of town hotel, ridiculous; 2. we reserved a non-smoking room an ended in a room with a strong cigarette odor and had to stay on it because the place was sold out; and, 3. they sell two room suites which are not real two room suites; they are a room with an area with a sofa bed and just one bathroom. Aside from that, the place looks wonderful. They serve a pretty good complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE EVER”
Reviews.Author: SEG-lover
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the most family friendly and excellent value in California. The breakfasts every morning were the best and all family members found much to love. The suites were clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and attentive. Then to top it off a nightly happy hour. The kids swam daily and also enjoyed fun non alcoholic drinks. From now on I will never stay anywhere besides an Embassy Suite hotel. Great job to them and they helped make our Calif. trip wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: seadog22
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites in La Jolla has alot going for it - good location between the 5 and 805 interstates for quick access to San Diego attractions and many restaurants, attractive appearance with a refurbished atrium, above average breakfast and evening manager's reception, clean rooms, friendly staff, BUT as other reviewers have noted, there are some drawbacks. The $20 a day parking fee is way overpriced for the location, the hotel is very popular with families so the breakfast is very crowded at times (although there is a hot buffet line separate from the made to order line which is fairly quick), and the soundproofing between rooms needs work. All in all a good value for the money and a hotel worth considering in San Diego. Watch the rates before your stay, we were able to get a very good price by switching to a prepaid rate (but be aware you cannot cancel so you are committed to paying).

Reviews.Title: “Great value for family travel”
Reviews.Author: Franklin_Kildaire
Reviews.Content: Hotel left a great impression on our family, and we'd put this hotel at the top of our list for a future trip. Stong point 1 is location. For family travel, we prefer suburban La Jolla to downtown San Diego. Near (but not next to) interstate 5. Not beachfront, but short drive to beach. Next to a shopping complex and office park. San Diego attractions and neighborhoods are easy to get to from hotel site. Strong point 2 is quality of premises and staff. Personnel are welcoming and efficient. Facilities are well maintained (gardening), exercise facilities/small pool, laundry facilities on premises, business center w/ pcs and printers. Facilities otherwise consistent with Embassy Suites hotels in other cities. Strong point 3 is quality of Embassy Suites features. Complimentary breakfast is top-notch (good selection, quality), efficient (guests served quickly w/o being made to feel rushed). Complimentary manager's reception also first class, not just an afterthought. What we experienced here was better than what we've found at other Embassy Suites locations. Weak point is a $20/night parking fee. I could understand this at a downtown location or with valet services but find off-putting at a self-park suburban location. Another reviewer mentioned on-street parking, but I respectfully disagree: it's really hard, on the spot, to make a snap judgment about availability and safety of on-street parking. To be candid, what bothers me most is the extra charge at a chain that markets lots of features included at a fixed price; had Embassy Suites increased the room rate by $20/night, we'd probably still have chosen the hotel. Our stay was for family travel, and our review is positive. But we'd echo other reviewers and caution business travelers. This hotel offers good service so has high occupancy rates, with lots of couples, families and school groups; this, plus the building's atrium design, generate traffic and some noise. For business travelers seeking calm, there's an Embassy Suites at downtown San Diego that's may be better suited (with no disrespect intended towards management of the La Jolla Embassy Suites).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vandelay2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in La Jolla and had a great stay there. The staff was very friendly and the location worked well for us as it was easy to get around. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - expensive, but no more so than others in the area.”
Reviews.Author: MidFortiesMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in five hotels in La Jolla in the past year and this is the one we'll be returning to. It's expensive, but all hotels in the area are expensive. For the money and the location (if you want to be near UC San Diego), it was our choice. The Marriott is a little newer but is expensive during the week (great prices on the weekends, though). The Sheraton is nice but is somewhat worn. The Residence Inn is very old and dirty. Embassy Suites has a very impressive, soaring lobby with koi ponds, waterfalls and plants. There is a made-to-order breakfast included that should please everyone. Beware of the price because in-room internet is more ($11.95 a day) and parking is $20 a day. There is lots of free parking on the street as long as you don't try to park on a school day (it's taken early). Make sure the hotel credits you back for parking. There is a nice business center with three computers and a printer that you can use for free (20 minute limit if others are waiting) so you don't need the in-room internet. What we really liked was that there are two rooms in each suite with a real, solid door between them. So many suites don't seem to have two real rooms but this one does. The staff seemed eager to please when we were there. A bit older but not too bad and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay great!!!”
Reviews.Author: cassidi9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel since we were going to a Dance Competition at the University of San Diego. This hotel was amazing!! When I called the hotel to see if I can check in early the front desk agent Jennifer who answered the phone was very polite and professional. She made every effort to check us in early. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by Jennifer as well. When we were in the lobby my 3yr old was amazed by the fish in the pond and didnt want to go anywhere but stay with the fish. The bed was so amazing and comfortable!!! We loved it!! The next day Saturday morning we came down and enjoyed the best breakfast!! My 3yr again was so excited to see the fish. We went to the desk and ask what kind of food the fish eat, and he was so nice and helpful he went to the back and got a little baggie of food for my 3yr old to feed the fish. This made her day!! Thank you so much for giving us such a great experience. I will come to the Embassy if I'm in San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “KIDS......And More Kids....”
Reviews.Author: fastdata
Reviews.Content: After doing extensive online research....I booked at the Embassy Suites as the Hyatt was asking for too much money. I looked at all the reviews and landed here. Embassy Suites is a type of hotel you either love or hate....As it has an enclosed atmosphere that is really not for those looking for quiet.. The first thing you notice kids everywhere...There was a waterpolo meet somewhere and all the kids were everywhere...I can live with the kids, HOWEVER the hotel allows these kids to play running up and down the halls. Yelling down to their friends from higher floors etc. They employ 3 guys to monitor the kids....that is how bad the kid situation is....For the good...the Manager reception free drinks and snacks really cool.... As for the room....Was put 2 rooms away from the elevators......When first got to room.. was ok but as the night went on you could hear the shaft noise and bell.... Lets just say sleeping was not easy...not only that...some sort of generator noise all night.. Made a complaint and was satisfied by result.... As for the breakfast very nice.... Overall would give this hotel a B- as no pool to speak of and jacuzzi was tiny..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to.stay”
Reviews.Author: ant1999e
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, location, very nice rooms, free breakfast. We loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Family-oriented hotel than business-travelers”
Reviews.Author: Stevedusa
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at the Embassy Suites in La Jolla. It wasn't the first choice nor it was out of faint of the heart. However I will admit the loyalty program pays. Most of the business travelers pick their stay based on the location. I am no exception. However keep in mind that the location of the hotel isn't a tourist hotspot, although La Jolla is about 10 miles to the west and the major tourist attractions are down south. What surprised me is that there are a lot of families here, which translates into lots of kids. Guests aside, the hotel is clean, modern and very guest friendly. Free breakfast, 2-hour free drink daily, what else can you ask? I stayed in the Executive suite. Upon check-in I was greeted by if not one of the most friendly staff I've ever met. Prompt service and makes me feel like a valued guest all the way. The room is very clean, nicely lay out and make me feel like home. Now if you staying here on a weekend or peak-tourist periods, you will hear kids. Door closed or not. Some running some screaming, but if that bother you or not is up to you. The bedroom on the other hand is like a standard hotel room but upgraded. Ceiling-to-floor window, comfortable bed and sheets. However if your room is facing the streets, prepare to hearing some car noises. Also the A/C unit can be loud. In my case it actually woke me up when it kicked in. However you can always keep it running to combat the outside noise but it's louder than comfortable level to sleep soundly, if you are a light sleeper. Over all I suggest this hotel to those who wants to get a suite but don't want to pay an arm and a leg for it. However some noise problem might be important to those who likes peace and quiet. This hotel is more suitable for families than business-travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Best Embassy Suites in San Diego Area”
Reviews.Author: joantri
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the other Embassy Suites in the San Diego area and this one is far nicer than the others. The room amenities as well as the maintenance of the room furniture seems to be new and not worn, did not have stains on the carpet, bathroom fixtures and tub not dingy. The location of this hotel is great. It is close enough for a drive to downtown La Jolla, but you avoid the traffic of getting in/out of that area. Plus, you are close to Balboa Park and across from a mall that has an indoor skating rink. The mall has some fast food options, but for a dining experience, I would go elsewhere. There is parking available on the street, so the parking of $20 overnight can be avoided. The housekeeping staff does an excellent job of daily cleaning with the attention to small details which is very impressive for an Embassy. We will definitely stay here again for the convenience of the location to all area attractions as well as the cleanliness of the rooms and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service and Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindsey2006
Reviews.Content: We were met with great help from the moment we arrived. We were immediately offered help with bags and a luggage cart. Check in was no problem, and very helpful. We were offered local info for restaurants and a map. Also staff was frank about the fact that you could easily park for free on the streets around the hotel and not pay for the ramp. The room was comfortable, had a pull out couch and chair in a sitting room, as well as a desk. There was a wet bar, refrigerator and microwave. All worked well and things were clean. The bathroom was nice sized, not too small. the bedroom had two comfy beds with nice linens. There was a TV in each room - the front sitting room and back bedroom. You do have to walk through the sitting room to enter the bedroom, so if you have a child napping in the sitting room you may be trapped in the bedroom. Free hot breakfast with cooked to order eggs/omlets each day. It was always busy but we always were able to find a place to sit, and there was plenty of food availble, nothing ran out. great free happy hour each night with beer and wine as well as some light snacks. The room was quiet, and we were on the top floor which i think helped as well. There was a great indoor pool, really a hot spot for kids and families. The hot tub was outside, just a few steps and great. Everyone was very friendly and helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rebeccagon1
Reviews.Content: This has been the best Embassy Suites we have stayed at. It was beautifully appointed, clean and the staff is very helpful and professional. The only inconvenience is parking. You have to pay for it and it is shared with the P.F. Chang's next door. Other than that, it is excellent. Be prepared to pay for it's beauty, too! What do yo expect in La Jolla?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service, happy hour, excellent breakfast, excellent restaurant. This was an excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Missy116
Reviews.Content: What a joy to find a hotel that actually lives up to it's promises on their website. I'm usually at least a little, if not terribly disappointed when I arrive. But in this case I was anything but disappointed. the staff was outstanding! The location was excellent, close enough to I-5 to get anywhere very quickly. Situated in beautiful LaJolla, with many restaurants and shops within walking distance. Just close enough to the airport to make it very convenient, but without the airport noise. We will definitely stay here again. The only negative thing I can think of is the $20 per night parking fee, but there is plenty of street parking!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent space, yummy breakfast and FREE evening drinks!”
Reviews.Author: Aprilfool1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed in La Jolla for 3 nights in Jan. What a great city - and not just for the zoo either. This hotel fit the bill nicely. The best feature of this hotel is the front desk staff. Our guy was awesome with info on the city, beaches and directions. Happy hour is about 2 hours of free bar drinks and snacks. Their restaurant is pretty good too. All of the rooms are suites, which was great for us, as I am an early riser and my boyfriend prefers to sleep a bit longer. If there was a downside to this hotel - it would just be that the parking lot is not attached to the hotel. But really...it was warm even in January. The walk was nothing in that beautiful SD weather.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but parking is too much for the area”
Reviews.Author: historyteacher50
Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable stay - staff was friendly; excellent breakfast and Happy Hour. The rooms look recently renovated and very clean. $20 is too much for parking in this area - it's not downtown San Diego. Another thing that was ridiculous was the per laptop charge per room. We were using 2 lap tops and we had 2 charges of $11 totalling $22. Most hotels charge one internet access charge.

Reviews.Title: “1st Embassy Suites Stay”
Reviews.Author: Coastie16
Reviews.Content: I have been a HH member for several years and never stayed at an Embassy Suites; needless to say, this was a pleasant surprise. Nice size room and amenities; however, the wet-bar, microwave and sink were a bit of an awkward layout. The door to the bedroom/bath area were "tight." Comfortable bed, but needed more feather pillows - something I will ask for in advance the next time around. Breakfast seems to be a feature item with Embassy Suites and seemed very popular with the guests. I did not take advantage of "eggs to order" but seemed to be very popular. Other breakfast items were good, well stocked - coffee could have been better. The only drawback to this hotel was the daily parking fee of $20/day.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Quality from Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: passandshoot
Reviews.Content: Overall what you expect from Embassy Suites. I guess in California it is also expected that you pay $20 a night for hotel parking for a parking structure that is difficult to navigate and the spaces are too small. Hotel has some construction going on in the lobby area. But room was clean, comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great stay”
Reviews.Author: katlive
Reviews.Content: For my friend's birthday we stayed here and had the most marvelous time. The staff was extremely accommodating and very helpful for all of our requests. We arrived just in time for happy hour, which was a great suprise and really enjoyed breakfast the next morning. The rooms were huge and the beds were extremely comfy. It is definitely a place I will stay the next time I go to La Jolla/San Diego. My only semi complaint is the same with all hotels in the San Diego area - I think it is ridiculous to charge for parking when you have a captive audience!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff and very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Alaskanworker
Reviews.Content: Rooms are fine - nothing wonderful, but the location for the value was very good. The gym is terrible - please upgrade this facility or just close it down! Nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Family/Business Trip to San Diego Area”
Reviews.Author: 2thdoc73
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Embassy Suites La Jolla from Nov 14-17, 2010. I was here on business, but my wife and two kids had their own fun while I was working. The hotel rooms are recently renovated about 3 years ago and it shows. Nice flat screen TVs, granite in bathroom, etc. We stayed on the 11th floor out of a possible 12 floors. I'm and HHonors member and can tell you this is a Category 7 hotel which means if you wanted to use reward points to stay here it would cost you 50,000 points per night. The complimentary breakfast and manager's receptions were great. There is a parking garage of about 4 levels and costs $19/day to park in there. This hotel is geared for business travelers, but families can stay here no problem. The pool is indoors, but the very small hot tub is outdoors. The business center computers were very slow. Our blackberries could surf the internet faster! One day house keeping was very late making up our room, but it's because there were lots of people checking out that day and those rooms get priority to be made up first before existing/ongoing guests rooms are made up. There is a Westfield Mall across the street which has a Starbucks which opens at 5am. There's also a Peets Coffee just down the street which opens at 6am. This hotel is about 20 minutes away from downtown San Diego. Definitely would stay here again if given the chance!

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Location for a La Jolla Stay”
Reviews.Author: ATravelerCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was nice, located conveniently between the 805 and 5. This hotel is great for those who want to enjoy being near by La Jolla (Located La Jolla UTC) without the expensive La Jolla Shores price. I found the rooms and lobby to be clean and comfortable. If I had any complaints I'd say rooms are a bit dated but why would you go to San Diego just to hang out in your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Take your kids and save money at Embassy Suites San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: SoCalMomHighland
Reviews.Content: We have 3 teenage boys and the breakfast they provide at Embassy Suites fills the boys up and they like it. We all enjoy the free happy hour and we all have a great time sitting around and relaxing and visiting. It is worth it to us to go to ES because of the "all suites" and the food. We go here a lot and 3 times we have been upgraded to the presidential suite ( 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, full living room, dining area, and the most wonderful loos you have ever seen.) The only downside there is the hotel restaurant. The food is pretty limited, expensive, and not all that good. They are never busy and I would guess that accounts for there lack of effort. The people at the front desk seem to be always on edge because sooo many people come in rude, demanding, and act like they deserve Waldorf Astoria treatment for 1/3 the price. Basically, very family friendly, a bit noisy, but clean, no bed bugs, and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as other Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Artybill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at more than a half dozen Embassy Suites in several states. We love Embassy Suites - Great bang for your buck! I'm not saying this particular property was not clean and comfortable, but the front desk people were not very helpful. and it costs $17 a day to park. Considering the fact that it is located in a high-end business area of San Diego/La Jolla called "the Golden Tiangle" I was disappointed at the level of service we received. There were no parking spots reserved for check-in so one has to park in the parking structure (no elevator) and haul your own bags. The bellperson is not always present and there is only one luggage cart. The breakfast offerings were minimal compared to other Embassy Suites. When my wife went to use the pool for the first time - we discovered her room key card did not work (1 of 2) She as not asked her room number but rather refused assistance unless she showed ID - she was on her way to the pool!! She didn't have ID! When we complained to the manager, we got a wimpy "that shouldn't have happened" No real apology or effort to make it up. As I said - when compared to other Embassy suites and considering it's location - I was dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “A chain, but nice place to stay in La Jolla”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyer666
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of ES hotels over the years, and this one is definitely a bit nicer and upscale. The layout is typical ES, which is to say you get your own room and there's a living room with big table that doubles as a desk. There's plenty of room for 1 person, and the bathroom in particular is quite spacious. My room was relatively high up, and it offered a very nice view of San Diego. All the amenities are present, just like other ES's. Breakfast was the usual ES style, which was fine. There are plenty of restaurants with a wide range of cuisines nearby. There's also a Crate and Barrel across the street. The staff was nice, but nothing special. Taxi to the airport was a fixed $50 rate. If you have business in La Jolla, this is a fine hotel. If you're going to downtown SD though, keep in mind this hotel is about 15 north of the city center, which can take some commute time during rush hours. For business travel though, I definitely think that ES is great. I got a lot of work done in the living room.

Reviews.Title: “For an Embassy Suites, good but short of great.”
Reviews.Author: Maikolo
Reviews.Content: For an Embassy Suites, this is a good hotel but short of great. Don't get me wrong, I don't think you will be disappointed. I checked into my room and discovered a bath tub full of backed up sewage. But, costumer service was great, and gave me an upgraded room. So I can't complain about that. The units are very roomy with a separate bedroom and large living room. Indoor pool and outdoor jacuzzi are a little small but still nice. Like most Embassy Suites, the floor plan of the hotel makes with the atrium in the middle amplifies voices and noises echo throughout the building. Just a minor problem though. Indoor parking is very limited and compact. Nice restaurants walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: berthoudrunner
Reviews.Content: We had such a good experience at this hotel. We stayed here for a week in late Oct. 2010. The complimentary made to order breakfast every morning was so good and the lobby area for eating was beautiful and clean. This was complimented by the friendly service staff and the excellent job they did clearing tables and making sure the turnover for breakfast moved along. Along the same lines the nightly reception was something to look forward after a long day of sight seeing and our two year old couldn't wait to get popcorn as soon as we got back to the hotel. The restaurant 'Indulge' also had good food and hefty portions. Spliting a sandwhich and a cup of soup was often enough for me and my husband to share. There was always ample parking and the location to all highways and downtown La Jolla was acceptable. Zoo, Sea World, and downtown were only about a fifteen to twenty minute drive. Rooms were very clean and quiet. I never heard a peep from any of our neighbors either beside us or above/below us. This was especially good since we have a two year old who still naps during the afternoon. Only things that could have been better was the noise level of the air conditioning unit, everytime it clicked on it was pretty loud. The bed was a little on the soft side and the mini frig could have used a good defrosting as it didn't seem to hold temp very well. However these were not significant enough to taint my view of staying here, we LOVED it and can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Small Water Features”
Reviews.Author: believeit_10
Reviews.Content: Love the full breakfast, but the pool and jacuzzi are very small for the size of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located to UCSD!”
Reviews.Author: dvanblake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in La Jolla when dropping my son off for his freshman year at UCSD> This hotel is very conveniently located to the school, and is great for families with several children. Especially older kids. Our room had lots of space, and the pull out sofa in the living area was actually very comfortable. The complimentary full cooked breakfast in the morning makes this a good deal for families with teen boys!!! We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! We made the right choice.”
Reviews.Author: trigre
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for a week in August. We loved the hotel. It is wasn't for the $19 dollars a day parking fee I would give it the highest rating. We loved this hotel. It was so clean and quiet. It was easy to get in and out of and was close to several things. My husband went down for the breakfast every day and he enjoyed it. I am not a breakfast person so I skipped it. I only had to deal with the staff a couple of times but they were always helpful and very nice. The rooms were so nice and it was great having two rooms since I stay up later than my husband. They have laundry rooms that are free to guests. That was very helpful to us. We used the business office a couple of times to print tickets for different tours we had purchased. This hotel met all our needs. I just can't say enough good things about Embassy Suites San Diego - La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet suites and a gigantic lobby!”
Reviews.Author: lynnandmarc
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here four nights at the end of August - beginning of September. When our kids saw the lobby of this hotel they were in heaven! There is a small koi fish pond with small waterfalls, four glass elevators, and you can look twelve floors straight up. Both the free breakfast buffets and the nightly Manager's Reception were in the lobby, so the kids enjoyed watching the elevators "race". The suite was roomy. We had a king bed in the bedroom, the kids slept on the pullout sofa in the living room, and there was a refrigerator and coffee maker. The bathroom had a massage showerhead. You did have to be careful going from room to room, however, so as not to get hit by the bathroom door. We appreciated the free drinks at the Managers Reception and the free breakfast. We typically went to breakfast at its busiest hour (8-9 AM), and never had a problem getting seating. The pool was indoors, which was good when it was cool. We ate at the restaurant Indulge twice. Try to sit outside by the fire pit. Laundry was free, which was great, but since there was only one working unit on each of floors 2, 5, and 12 (floors 3 and 4 were out of service), we spent a lot of time going up and down. The concierge Adam was very helpful suggesting nearby beaches where the kids took surfing lessons. Overall, we'd stay here again. The kids practically cried when we had to say goodbye to the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Street Parking Risk”
Reviews.Author: joseph1963
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews about the $19 a day parking garage fee and tips to park free on the street. I parked on the street near PF Changs and feel pretty certain someone clipped a tail light on my car while parking. There was a crack in the lens on the morning of the third day. I was wishing I had parked in the garage but it sounds like it also has a few risks. There were a lot of cars coming and going to the restaurant increasing the odds of accidental damage. Overall, it was a good place to stay. Here are a few of the cons: My son said the sofa bed was very uncomfortable, as the mattress was very thin. The A/C compressor cycled frequently and was noisy despite leaving the fan on all the time and wearing earplugs. The coffee was extremely hot. I was carrying two stacked cups to our room when the top cup tipped and spilled a small amount despite the lid, and left a nasty burn on my chest which is still there. I have never understood why the ES charges for the internet and local calls while the lower-priced hotels offer them free. The staff was friendly. I had booked online and checked the rate two days before the trip finding the rate was reduced from $197 to $170. It was past the cancellation deadline, so I called the hotel and they gave me the lower rate. Two restaurants I would recommend: Point Loma Seafoods on the waterfront had fresh seafood and very reasonable prices as noted by Rachel Ray on one of her shows. Corvette Grill in Point Loma was a 50's style diner with an era Corvette at the entrance, continuous black and white movies on many screens and waiters/waitresses dressed in that era and a menu to match.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: OCGuyOrangeCountyCA
Reviews.Content: If you're travelling with children, this is a good place. In the evening they serve drinks (alcohol for adults, juice and soft drinks for kids) and snacks. In the morning there is an extensive free breakfast. The weekend we were there, the staff was overwhelmed at breakfast time (clearing tables, re-stocking food), but they did their best. Indoor swimming poo is ideal for children and an outdoor jacuzzi is nice for adults. Good location near freeways -- short ride to Wild Animal Park , La Jolla beaches, and central San Diego. Big rooms ideal for a family of 4 or 5. $19 overnight parking for guests is steep, but there is some street parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: da-reef
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say how good the manager was. When we arrived they made us wait 2 hours for our room after check-in-time. We made the reservations 2 months in advance. After talking to the manager he took care of us and made everything right again. His name is Zarko Lucic. The Embassy Suites is lucky to have a person of his experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kewilli
Reviews.Content: My husband, my mom, my two daughters, 3 and 8, and I stayed at this beautiful hotel for 4 nights and had a great stay. It is a beautiful hotel with a great koi pond that my 3 year old loved. Although it was beautiful it was still comfortable. Sometimes I cringe when my kids are walking through very nice places because I'm afraid they'll touch something, but not here. The staff is friendly and the breakfast is awesome. We found something for everyone, even my picky eaters! We will stay there the next time we go on vacation! Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: VaBest1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, rooms are small but nice, a lot of parking (kind of expensive $19 a day and I was there 18 days) and they had a free washer and dryer on the floor I was staying on. The breakfast wasn't bad the one time that I had time to eat. Love the free beer and wine from 1730 to 1930. The internet wasn't free, but I think had I been a diamond member it would have. Great hotel for a few nights. I had no real poblems. I wish parents wouldn't allow their kids run in the hotel as if they was running outdoors. Not really the place for kids to be running anyway. May stay was from Apr 12, 2010 till Apr 30, 2010

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites LaJolla has the most outstanding staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sricewithtwins
Reviews.Content: Diamond earning returned from the most incredibly honest hotel staff in the world. – Embassy Suites LaJolla !!!! Can you believe housekeeping found my very $$$$$ diamond earning and returned them to me (along with two baby bibs, baby toys & other items)!!!! Thank you Embassy Suites LaJolla for hiring outstanding employees!!!!! This is a great place to stay with the family. My husband, mother and twin girls (20 months old) stay for two night and had an excellent time. The hotel has been remolded - rooms are very nice, the staff is very friendly, and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Tusich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights over Easter weekend. Check in was quick - we arrived at 1 pm, and our room was ready despite of the fact that check in time, I think, is 4 pm. Suite was a little bit dark, but I guess, all suites are like this unless you take a corner suite with the balcony. Room was clean and noise level is OK. I didn't hear our neighbors upstaires or in the next room. Location is OK - it took us 10 mins to drive to drive to La Mesa and dine at their "Red Lobster". La Jolla shores are 10 mins away as well. It was nice to stroll there in the evening. Seaworld is 15 mins away on I-5. Breakfast and happy hour every day are included in room price. Breakfast could be a little better though. Very limited amount of fruits and veggies. Only banana and oranges, and actually no veggies at all. No yougurt or cottage cheese. At least, Hilton Suites include those items in their free breakfast. Evening happy hour included all kinds of wine and coctails (with the show of ID and your room key), chips and salsa, pretzels and slices of pita bread with little bit of hummus on them. Indoor pool was always crowded though, with kids in particular. I booked this hotel because of it's indoor pool knowing that it can be chilly in SoCal in March-April. My daughter swam there, however, all days - in the morning and in the evening, but I coulldn't get it because of tons of screaming and splashing kids. But that's Ok with me, I didn't want to swim anyways... Pool towels were too tiny, but I guess, it's OK for the kids. Oh, and no robes in the room (just comparing it with Hilton Suites). Also, there was too much chlorine in the pool - I could't comb my daughter's hair after each swim... We haven't tried their restaurant "Indulge", but it looked nice in the evening, especially the patio with heated lamps, couches with pillows and fire pits.
