You then go through a door, and to the left was a roomy and very nice bathroom with a tub/shower combo, a hairdryer and stocked with towels and toiletries. To the right, across from the bathroom, was a large closet with mirrored doors, there was a shelf & rod for clothes, a suitcase valet, and an iron& ironing board. At the end of that hall was the bedroom, with 2 double beds, my husband and I had one bed and our 3 and 5 year old boys shared the other bed, there was a dresser/vanity with an ottoman. On the other end of the dresser was a flat screen tv. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful with many choices, cereal, friut, pastries, bagels, donuts, yougurt, juice coffee and best of all the hot breakfast bar. Grab a small bowl and choose your own ingredients, hand it to the chef and they make it into a scramble or omelett, you also can have pancakes, french toast, bacon & sausage. We too enjoyed the complimentary late afternoon/evening manager's happy hour. Crackers, chips, salsa, drinks with or without alcohol. The pool was nice, but could get a little noisy when there was more than 1-2 families with kids at a time.........Not all parents were good about keeping their children from making to much noise, or hogging the entire pool. Three suggestions would have made the stay better: Bigger Beds Better Parking Rates - $17 a day was steep Cable TV - only had the East Coast Feed for the Kids channels, not good considering you are having fun in the sun all-day and then want the kids to settle down..........and their programing is already over by 3pm, because it was the East Coast Feed. We dealt with it, rented them a couple of programs..........but that too can add up on an extended stay. This was the best 6 night, 7 day stay with our boys ages 3 and 5 years old..............the 2-room suite was supper family friendly and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: phiflyers
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at this hotel for a vacation weekend (Thursday July 19th-Sunday July 22nd) and were pretty pleased with our experience. The location of the hotel is perfect as it is about a mile off the highway and isolated from any highway noise. The hotel lobby was recently remodeled and it looked like they were putting the finishing touches on everyone when we checked in. The check-in process was very easy and we were in our room in no time after a long evening of traveling. The room was pretty spacious for the 3 of us and included an HD flat-screen in the "living room", mini-fridge, microwave, and even a bar-sink. 2 of us slept in the king-sized bed and 1 in the pull out queen sleeper sofa. The sleeping arrangements were very comfortable as we were able to close off the 2 sides of the suite for a little privacy. There were a couple of complaints that we had regarding the room and one of them ended up being addressed while we stayed there. The a/c system was very loud when it kicked on and would definitely wake up a light sleeper, and ended up waking me up on a few occasions. The first time we used the shower it would take forever to drain and the 2nd person taking a shower would always stand in a puddle of water. After making a call to the front desk they sent someone up to the room and it was fixed the next time we took a shower. Our rate, as well as everyone else's, included the great breakfast that they put on every morning. There is a large crowd in the breakfast area every day, but the spread that is available was one of the best I have seen in a hotel and we were all very pleased. We ordered room service 1 night and found the food to be very tasty and reasonably priced. A major that we had regarding the hotel itself was the elevators on Sunday (our check-out day). Everyone seemed rushed to get out of the hotel at the same time and this created a huge line at the elevators. We ended up taking the stairs down because it would have taken at least 30 minutes to get down had we waited for the elevator. Overall, we were very satisfied with our stay at this hotel and our choice of La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Great Remodel”
Reviews.Author: Misha22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while on business in San Diego. I stayed here a year ago and the hotel has been remodeled since. The remodel is very tasteful and modern. Only slight complaints include the shower curtain liner and manager's reception. The shower curtain liner is cheap plastic and looked to be quite "used." A cloth liner would have been nice and much easier to keep clean. I've stayed a lot of Embassy Suites where there is a decent manager's reception with hot appetizers that change daily. This one just provides potato chips and pretzels. The remodel is quite upscale and you would think little details such as these would get the same attention as the rooms. Beware of the high hotel taxes and parking garage expense ($17/day). The garage's design will test your patience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Don't hesitate to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: honey_bah
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate via the hotel website. Stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Seaworld. The hotel is winding up remodeling. The rooms were very spacious and clean. They smelled brand new! Plenty of room for our family of 5, with the living room and separate bedroom. We had a corner room and these are a bit bigger than other rooms. My parents were next door and were not in a corner room, so their room was a bit smaller yet still big. Our kids really enjoyed th Koi pond. One of the hotel staff gave them some food for the fish. That was very relaxing after a long day on the road. The breakfast was yummy. The lines were long, but the food was well worth it. All of the hot foods likes eggs, bacon, sausuage, french toast, pancakes, etc. were cooked to order. Check in was a breeze. We will definately stay here again when traveling to San Diego. This is one of the nicest hotels that we've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel/ Outstanding personal”
Reviews.Author: Luella10
Reviews.Content: I was actually shocked upon reading the most recent reviews. We recently stayed there and had a fantastic experience. We spent an entire week and enjoyed every minute of it. We had just spent a week at the Disneyland Hotel, which does not hold a candle to this hotel. The housekeeping was flawless!!! Everything was perfect everyday. For the review that said they passed up breakfast, what a mistake. It was great, and we are very fussy about our hotels and food. We have stayed out at the HotelDel on Coranado Island several times, so we have much to compare it to. The parking can be a little tricky, but you will find this to be true for almost everywhere in the area. Don't be fooled by the parking fee. Some hotels say they don't have one, however it is included in the hotel price somewhere. Thats what they do at Disney. Getting back to the breakfast, we have never stayed at any hotel that offered a free breakfast that was so delicious. The staff in the kitchen area was wonderful and they worked very hard to keep things going smoothly. Well done!!! For those of you traveling on business, be prepared for families to be there as well. This is a hotel with suites, so many people with families stay there. We are a family of 5 and we really enjoyed our stay. Trust me, I read these reviews like crazy. And sometimes I change my mind and cancell. Don't cancel, its a great place. Yes, there is a bit of construction going on but we were aware of that before we came.

Reviews.Title: “Room for 5 in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Deuga
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 just got back from a 1 week vacation at the Embassy Suites, La Jolla. We stayed in a 2 room suite. Here's a rundown: LOCATION If you're on vacation, we found this hotel to be in a perfect location. We were close to everything including lots of great restaurants. SERVICE We found service to be excellent throughout the hotel, including in the food service area. ROOMS We had a king bed in the bedroom. Two of my kids slept in the foldout couch. The third slept on a cot. The foldout couch and cot were too soft in my opinion, but my kids could care less. The rooms are spacious if you're 2 people, with 5 people you might find yourself wishing for more space if you spend any down time in your room. We didn't do much of this so it was of little regard for us. If the rooms have one design flaw it's that the microwave and frig are behind the door the separates the bedroom from the living area when that door is open. In addition, you have to open a pair of doors to open to get to the microwave and frig even when the bedroom door is closed. Typically the bedroom door is open so to get to the frig you have to close the bedroom door, open up the double doors to the frig/microwave area, then open up the frig. Following that you'd close all three. The rooms have been recently redone and look great. Yes, the 42'' HDTV in the living area is awesome. I watched a few minutes of the MLB all-star game on it and it looked great. I can typically find something broken, not working, torn, or busted in any hotel room I stay in regardless of the hotel chain. I tend to think nothing of it. After staying here I week I found absolutely nothing flawed in any way. Even the shower water temperature was shockingly perfect every time and never varied one iota during any shower. PARKING They charge $17/day parking for parking. Overall in this area of La Jolla I noticed that parking was a precious commodity at some restaurants as well. To me you either accept that before you book or you book your stay elsewhere. I accepted it from this perspective: I'm paying an extra $17, but getting a complete breakfast for no additional charge. For a family of 5, I've have paid $40 per day to replace that breakfast, unless we went to McD's every day and that would have gotten very old, very fast. Parking is tight if you try to park during the evening, it's never a problem during the day. Over the course of a week I had to fight to find a parking spot once. COMPLEMENTARY BREAKFAST Overall I thought the breakfast was great. The food was high quality. The omelette's were great, they had pancakes every day, french toast some days. The selection was overwhelming, if you couldn't find something you liked here, then your standards are extremely high for what is mostly a buffet. There's been a significant amount of discussion regarding the crowding. Here's the scoop, there are plenty of tables to sit at. You can sit in the atrium and watch Koi, or eat in the Coast Cafe (they don't do breakfast in the Cafe), or outside on the terrace. The problem is that the layout of the buffet is very poorly done. The cook eggs to order line is at times too long b/c you've got people thinking that's where they're supposed to go even if they don't want an omelette. However you can get anything you want without waiting in that line if you don't want eggs. I found short lines or no lines all week everywhere else in the buffet. But I do agree that there's alot of bumping and jostling going on when you're getting your food. You can avoid all the jostling and crowd if you get to breakfast before 8am during the week and before 9am on weekends. There's can also be a huge difference in the omelette line between 8:20 during the week and 8:29, for example. I spoke with the ass't manager about the breakfast layout. She said it's not a part of the redesign they're doing. However they have been discussing it and are going to look at possible options for making the food selection process flow better. RECONSTRUCTION The front entry area is still under construction as well as the business center. They said they expect the business center to be up by next week. They expect the rebuild to be complete by the end of July. Overall, this didn't inconvenience us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, service inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: melhj
Reviews.Content: We chose the Embassy Suites La Jolla based on the reviews and recommendatation on this website. The location was good, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We had no issues with parking as some previous posters. The concierge was also extremely helpful. The one thing that marred our stay was the terrible behaviour of their wait and cooking staff at breakfast. During check in, we had asked about breakfast hours. We were informed that it was from 6-9am and that as long as we got there a little before 9am, we would be able to enjoy the buffet till past 9. Taking these words to heart, we went down at 8.50am (we were on vacation!!) and stood in line to get our cooked food. 9am came along and in the blink of an eye, the line for cooked food was shut off, the shutters to the kitchen came down, the cold food including fruit, bread and cereal were cleared. Even plates were taken away. My niece asked the staff for an apple (he had just cleared it and placed the basket of apples on his trolley right in front of him) and he refused!!! The staff told her that breakfast closes at 9am and so she could not have the apple! I can accept the cooked food station closing on time but most decent hotels, leave the cold food for at 15-20 mins before shutting it down. Also, they will inform diners that the buffet is closing. Nothing of this sort happened at the Embassy Suites. I guess that Embassy Suites is just a good hotel wannabe, that has not quite succeeded. Anyway, quite appalled by this, I went to the speak to the front desk to give feedback, only to be told "That's just the way it is here. Breakfast shuts down at 9am". I'm not sure if our feedback reached management, because the next morning, the Food and Beverage manager was present at breakfast, and this time, the cold food buffet stayed open about 10 minutes past nine. But the earlier experience was extremely off- putting and I doubt we will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wise_One
Reviews.Content: From the comfortable rooms, internet access, to the staff and the excellent breakfasts. Nothing bad to say about this place. Exceeded my expectations and a joy of a place to stay for business.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmysmommy
Reviews.Content: We chose the Embassy Suites in La Jolla due to the location - not to mention the free hot breakfast. The hotel was nice, clean, and the staff friendly. There was construction going on downstairs - currently the gift shop and lobby area are undergoing renovations. We did not hear construction noises so that was good. The room was very spacious with a separate living room/office area and then the bedroom. I couldn't find the fridge/microwave at first but they are hidden behind a set of doors between the two rooms. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant but we did have the free hot breakfast both mornings we were there. They offered omelettes, waffles, pancakes, bacon, sausage, breakfast potatoes, pastries, cereals, bagels, and fresh fruit and other things that I can't recall!! We actually extended our stay by one night. Our request was promptly taken care of and we even were given the promotional rate for the 2nd night as well. The only negative about our stay was the sound of little kids running around downstairs in the atrium/lobby level early in the morning. The sound really carries and it seems that parents had no control over their little "cherubs" in the morning. (And we had our daughter with us so I'm not anti children! ) Oh, and our room keys kept getting deactivated for some reason. (they were not touching anything that would cause that to happen!) The pool was indoor and on the small side. It was a bit crowded when we ventured there in the afternoon. However, it was still functional. The hotel is across the street from a mall (University Town Center) that has a lot of shops and restaurants. There is a PF Changs Restaurant in the same parking lot as the hotel - we ate lunch there one afternoon. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andypandyengland
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the Embassey Suites, great rooms with a seperate lounge/TV area which is handy when you have young children that tend to sleep in, breakfast was great ( busy at peak times though ) happy hour from 5.30pm-7.30pm was a must with all drinks and snacks free. The glass elevators were fun which the kids loved, as they did the indoor pool, the shopping mall right accross the street was also very convienient as it has an ice skating ring. If we visited San Diego again this would be the only hotel we would consider , a fantastic place and ONE OF THE BEST hotels we have had the pleasure of staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Tovin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here March 26-28 for a business meeting he had in the Miramar area. The room was very well appointed, comfortable, and the staff was wonderful. The parking however, sucks. $17 a day, though it includes in and out privileges. The garage is so narrow it only allows one car on the path at any time, and if there are 2 SUV's parked at an angle against each other, you may well be unable to get past them. There were always plenty of spots available, but there is no handicap access to the top 2 floors. The breakfast (complementary) area was extremely packed, but was really quality food, hot, cleaned often, and attended well. The morning staff truly excelled. There were 3 busses of soccer and lacrosse high school students that arrived on Thursday night, making the pool, breakfast area, and lobby pretty much unpleasant for anyone over 18, and the elevators were apparently, play things. Not a whole lot the hotel staff could have done other then the way it was handled (pulling kids off elevators, doing an excellent job with the breakfast even with the cramped conditions, etc.). The lukewarm water was unpleasant on Friday, but Saturday it heated well, after a few moments. University Towne Center (UTC) is right across the street, and was a wonderful day trip for me while my husband completed his meetings. La Jolla Shores was a mere 10 minutes away, and the concierge was wonderful in getting directions and information about the goings on there. Overall, an excellent stay that I would recommend to anyone, especially business travelers taking along a companion, as there's much to do, and it's easily connected to the San Diego Metro system through busses. The lobby is really relaxing, and the setup was truly wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Rooms & Setting!”
Reviews.Author: MisterBill48
Reviews.Content: I initially had some concerns that the remodeling might still be underway during my stay, but upon arriving, I found everything to be very fresh and immaculate! The executive suite was newly remodeled, and I loved the layout, furniture, fixtures, and everything else. It truly is comfortable and relaxing! The flat screen TV in the living room was a nice surprise, and the bed was so comfortable that I actually felt I was asleep at home. Since I always got downstairs on the early side (due to normally being 2 hours ahead by living in the central time zone), I really enjoyed the breakfast, and was able to find lots of fresh selections and plenty of tables available. It does crowd up considerably if you choose to go later, though! The pool was very nice, but in all fairness, some of the parents really overindulged in letting their small children run wild! I can well understand the enthusiasm of being on vacation and having as much fun as possible, but I wouldn't want to think that anyone would get hurt as a result of kids running around on wet pavement or jumping into the pool almost on top of someone else (it almost happened to me!), etc. Perhaps the hotel should consider setting an hour or two aside for adults to swim, while children could do something elsefor fun.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a lot more”
Reviews.Author: Neutron1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a "business suite" here for a week that had a desk type piece of furniture but no chair and a TV on it so it was not usable as a desk. No wet bar and no table/chairs and their website advertises that every suite has this, High Speed Internet was only wireless and the only place I could get a usable signal was sitting on the floor near the door. Parking is $17/day and the garage has 1 driving lane for up and down traffic and it fills up quick so you may or may not park there even though you paid for it. Plus when you get to the top it is still 1 car wide so you have to back down 3 levels all while stopping the traffic coming up, telling them there is no parking and then telling them they have to back up as well. I will not be going back here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJH-in-Austin
Reviews.Content: Good points: - very clean and well furnished - friendly staff - nice beds Problematic for Business Travelers 1) No speaker phone in room. Very annoying if your business is global and requires extensive late night conference calls. Inexcusable for such an expensive Hilton property. 2) Mobbed Breakfast Area. This property clearly markets aggressively to get huge families on vacation from Latin America. Makes the breakfast area hopelessly unusable. 30 minute waits for everything. Even worse, there is no nearby substitute restaurant (a solution I have used at other Embassy Suites) 3) No hot water circulation system. Not a business travel problem, but inexcusable for such a premium property. Have to wait 5-10 min for the hot water to warm up all the pipes between the basement and the top floor before you can take a shower. Premium properties worldwide usually have a system that constantly circulates hot water on each floor to avoid this lag. 4) Inept laundry service. Was 2 hours late. But they also forgot to charge me for it. 5) Expensive and clumsy parking system. Garage is reasonably nice, but they want $17/day for it and they have to fumble around with your room number every time you drive in and out. And they also have trouble keeping track of your charges which requires multiple visits to the front desk to correct their cooridination problems. 6) Slow room cleaning. Rooms still not serviced at 4PM on some days. 7) Sealed Windows. Again, not a business travel problem, but I hate hotels that won't let you get fresh outside air into the room... particularly frustrating when you are near the ocean and can't enjoy the offshore ocean breeze in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome bed, pillows and newly redecorated!”
Reviews.Author: California Sun
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here at least 15 to 20 times now and have always been satisfied with the hotel, the parking is a little hard but the stay is worth it. They did a fantastic job with remodeling the rooms. The flat screen T.V.s, modern furniture, awesome bed and pillows that I promise you will have no trouble resting your head on. The breakfast is fast, hot and made to order. I have had dinner inside the hotel many nights and it was excellant each time. The rooms are quite, spacious and the newly redecorated bathrooms are equally beautiful. Great buy for the money and you can't beat the short walk to PF Changs!

Reviews.Title: “Predictable Excellence”
Reviews.Author: withay53
Reviews.Content: I am a regular at this location. I stay for 12 days and nights, five to six times a year. When I check in the front desk staff addresses me by name. They are always courteous and professional. The rooms here are excellent. The housekeeping staff is professional and attentive to any special needs. The breakfast fare is excellent and the staff is capable and quite friendly. The managers reception is a nice benefit and the staff, as usual, is quite friendly. Being a two week resident, I appreciate the free laundry on several floors of the hotel. It allows me to pack light if I choose, and do my laundry conveniently near my guest room. The restaurant staff is very friendly and ready to see that your food and service meets the high standards that have come to be known worldwide with Embassy Suites. The staff that takes care of my conference needs are the best. They check in daily to ensure all my needs are met. Relating to the indoor property, my wife once said, "this is one hotel where if it were raining all day you would not be disappointed being trapped inside". If you have ever been to an embassy suites, you know exactly what we mean. The location of the property is perfect with top name dining within walking distance, one of the largest malls across the street and the beautiful beaches of San Diego minutes drive west. With all of the upgrades in rooms, and public meeting areas going on in 2007, I can't imaging a more ideal property for the family, business person, or group event. I feel spoiled having my conferences here and hope my organization continues it's long relationship with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomend it”
Reviews.Author: JPAMF
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler I have never written an "atta boy" for a hotel. In this case I must. It's the people that make this hotel a great place to stay. I stay here at least 5 times a year for mutiple night stays and hope that I never have to stay at another place while in the San Diego area. Many of the staff have been around for a long time and from the time you rise in the morning, the happy, helpful people that greet you at breakfast seem egar to see that you are pleased, contented and serviced. The front desk people always have a smile and a quick warm greating and they seem to thrive on making it their business making you feel welcome. The housekeeping department are adept at doing an efficient job and seldom being seen, but when you do it is always with a smile and a warm hello. I have seen a great improvement in the restaurant staff in the past visits, They have joined the team effort that permiates the rest of the building. The bartender is great and friendly, constantly looking out for the comfort of the customer. The new look of the rooms is great, first class all the way. It is so great to have a staff that work so well together at taking care of the needs of the guests. My kuddos to the management staff for creating a great team.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for SoCal Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BoCoTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 4 and 6 year olds as 'home base' for going to Legoland, Sea World, etc. It was a great value for our family. Breakfast was good and exciting for the kids each morning, cocktail hour was exciting for us parents each evening! Kids LOVED feeding the fish in the lobby. We walked across the street to the mall food court for budget friendly dinners and lunches. Overall a great experience, complaints were not enough to warrant mentioning.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Construction Nov 06-Feb 07”
Reviews.Author: gottwoboys
Reviews.Content: I am a veteran of Embassy Suites. This one seems fancy at first glance...nice atrium, ritzy town, etc. But the happy hour snacks and breakfast were sub par to other Embassys...guess each hotel puts out what it wants. Just chips and salsa, not even veggies which Oxnard always serves. Had taquitos in SLO. No make your own waffles like in Oxnard and Monterey. They don't even sautee the veggies for the omelette, just slap in some egg and served to you. They just started renovating this hotel, the 3rd and 4th floors were completely closed. I was not told when I made the reservation on ES but was told at check-in. Probably was not a problem unless you were planning on spending lots of time in your room, but Sat. AM we were awakened by hammering sounds at 8 am. Thought that was inappropriate, and was just pissed that I wasn't told at reservation time. I think that is sneaky!! Ditto on the room arrangement. Bedroom nice size but the living area is small and the microwave and fridge blocks hallway if you want in. There are always doors swinging and blocking someone. We asked to switch rooms, as we had one on opposite side of elevators, which bedroom window overlooked large A/C compressor and main street. They offered to move us from 7th to 11th floor, but with same side of bldg did not seem worth it. As it turned out, the A/C and fan in the room makes a lot of noise and blocked whatever street noise we were anticipating. $15/night for parking is a ripoff, but I guess parking is tight in this rich town. ALso, the bellhop nearly rushed us at the door. Frankly I prefer to take the cart and do it myself, but guess they don't want to be screwed out of a tip. Kids liked the pool, but it is small. Would have been nice if they had a pool table or video game room like Monterey. My kids loved it there! Actually, Seaside, adjacent to Monterey. All in all we like this chain because of the freebies and the private bedroom. Oh yeah, usually in Embassys you can bring your own DVD or video game systems, and just plug in to the TV through the A/V inputs, but in this hotel, they have deactivated the inputs. They want you to pay for movies and games. I expect that in other hotels, but most other Embassys I have done this so I was disappointed. Overall OK, just not as nice as I am used to in Embassys, and not a Cat. 6 in my book!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: CoCoa04
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in the door, I felt very unwelcome. The staff was rude, in fact the entire town was so snooty. Be sure to ask how long breakfast will be served. Apparantly it is different times depending on midweek or weekend. We were never advised & missed breakfast the 2nd morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ganymede77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on vacation for 3 nights in late Sept 2006. Despite a lot of digging I was unable to find a hotel that met our needs (quality/price) in Lo Jolla village proper so we finally decided to stay nearby and this hotel appeared to offer the best value. We were very pleased with our choice. The design of the facility is similar to other large Embassy Suites (eg. Chicago). Very dramatic lobby and interior and great suite rooms. The ES suites arrangement always seem very generous to me in comparison to most other hotels. The entire facility was clean and well maintained. Service was very attentive. Location is convenient - it's on a major travel road and across from a large mall. Convenient to La Jolla village, Scripps aquarium and Route 5. Parking is slightly extra but very convenient with an adjacent indoor garage. Embassy provides good value with an excellent breakfast as well as a nice complimentary cocktail hour with snacks (salsa and chips, etc). We avoided the in-house restaurant for dinner because it didn't look that exciting and because there a lot of good alternatives nearby. I'm a tough grader. I recommend this hotel. It's not a romantic getaway but you could do a lot worse for business or personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Small Rooms?”
Reviews.Author: TeamIguana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Jolla Embassy Suites with our 18 month old for four nights. Taking the advice of others, we requested a room high up and not facing the street. The rooms are a bit small and narrow. We have stayed at other Embassy Suites and this was by far the smallest as far as room size. The walls were pretty thin and although we had a stairwell on one side (no noise there) we were able to hear the baby and singing father next door for at least one of the nights. Having kids of our own we understood but it tells you how thin the walls are. The room had a weird configuration where the door separating the bedroom from the living room opened and blocked the doors leading to the microwave and refrigerator. We found this a bit annoying. We did like the Koi ponds in the lobby. All rooms have a window facing out as well as a window facing the inner atrium. This atrium is over 14 floors high with the pond and breakfast dining area in the court yard. The location is great. Right next to the 805 freeway and across the street from the University Town Center outdoor mall. There are all kinds of places to eat and shop there. You do have to cross a major street (almost like a freeway the way people drive so stroller pushers beware) and it ends up being about 2 or 3 blocks until you find any restaurants. The UTC area is quite fun once you are there. There is also a mini play ground near Sears and a bunch of fountains through out. Some very accessible to little ones who want to get wet. The somewhat frilly Chinese food restaurant PF Changs is right outside the entrance. A bit pricey for small servings of Chinese food but from the wait and valet lines you would think they were givng it away. More on the hotel. It does have a indoor swimming pool but it is rather small. More for taking a dip than trying to do laps. And it is strange but they put the jacuzzi just outside the doors in the outside with lounge chairs available. The breakfast was not bad but they seem to limit the omelets to just one type every morning. No custom omlets which I have seen at other Embassy Suites. The Manager's reception was the usual chips and salsa and drinks but what do you expect for free? I read a review about a watch being stolen but I suppose the best advice is not to leave valuables lying around. It made me a little anxious about the staff but then again why would you want to take that chance? There is a parking lot where you basically have to pay the $15/day to park. I really don't know what happens if you tell them you don't have a car or just park across the street in the mall. There are also some unregulated spaces that do not require an entrance gate so I don't know who monitors those. The parking thing always annoys me but I know about it in advance so what can you do? Overall I would give this 3 and a half stars but there is no middle choice between 3 and 4 and I would not say that this was an exceptional hotel. Just very clean and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a lovely place.”
Reviews.Author: Larkmom
Reviews.Content: What a great deal especially for a family of 4. The beds were very comfortable though they can probably get newer cribs. The crib was small even for my 15 month old. The rooms were spacious and so was the bathroom. We especially liked having the pond in the hotel which kept the kids entertained while we were at the managers reception in the evening. The breakfast was fantastic, and the staff members were very friendly and accomodating. There is a restaurant in the hotel but also a PF Changs just in front of it. La jolla is a beautiful place and the hotel is nicely located. It's very quiet though we knew the hotel was full. It's a place where you can relax and get a good night's sleep after a busy day. We will definitely stay here again in 2007.

HotelInfo.Name: Embassy Suites San Diego - La Jolla
HotelInfo.Address: 4550 La Jolla Village Drive, San Diego, CA 91214
